description: From Hindi बुरक़ा (burqā) / Urdu برقع‎ (burqā), from Persian برقع‎ (borqa'), from Arabic بُرْقُع‎ (burquʕ).

entries.meaning: An Islamic garment that covers the whole body, which has a net screen covering the eyes so they cannot be seen, and is worn by women.
examples: Synonyms: (especially in Central Asia) paranja, chadri

description: From Russian бу́рка (búrka); further etymology is disputed.

entries.meaning: A dress made from felt or karakul (the short curly fur of young lambs of the breed of that name), traditionally worn by men of the Caucasus region.
